intro: Mapouria patrisii, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Mapouria patrisii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
